xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Basic XQuery equivalents of map, fold, and filter functions adapted from the standard library of the Scheme programming language. Demonstrates the use of higher-order functions in eXist.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: seq:filter
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: seq:filter($func as function, $seq as item()*) as item()*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Filters the passed sequence by calling $func for every item. All items for which $func returns true are copied to the output sequence, items for which it returns false are skipped.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: seq:fold
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: seq:fold($func as function, $seq as item()*, $start as item()) as item()*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Calls $func for all items in the sequence. For example, if the sequence is (1, 2, 3), $func will be called with arguments (1, 2) and (3, 3).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: seq:map
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: seq:map($func as function, $seqA as item()*, $seqB as item()*) as item()*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Applies $func to the items of two sequences and returns the results as a new sequence. Both input sequences should have the same length.
